text: Tropical Storm Fabian was a short-lived tropical storm during the 1991 Atlantic hurricane season. It was the sixth storm of that year which was given a name. It formed in the northwest Caribbean southwest of Cuba. The storm reached a peak intensity of 45 mph (75 km/h), shortly before crossing over Cuba as it moved northeast past Florida. Fabian became extratropical north of the Bahamas the next day, and dissipated on October 17. Fabian caused only light rainfall along its path and there were no reported deaths or damage. Category:1991 Atlantic hurricane season Category:1991 events Category:Atlantic tropical storms Category:October events Category:20th century in Cuba Category:1990s in Florida Category:1991 in the United States
title: Tropical Storm Fabian (1991)
